precontext: Lily was sitting by the pond, listening to the gentle rustling of the leaves. She had been visiting this spot every day, hoping to see some wildlife. A frog appeared on a rock, looking still and mysterious.
meanings_considered: pass from physical life and lose all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life
utter a hoarse sound, like a raven
explanation:
• The frog making a sound like a croak is a common and expected behavior for frogs in the natural environment described.  
• The meaning of "pass from physical life" does not fit, as the frog is still visible and active, and the context describes it as "looking still and mysterious," not dying.  
• The precontext emphasizes auditory observation ("listening to the gentle rustling") and wildlife, making the sound-based meaning highly plausible and contextually grounded.
